body_html:
For people with similar issue issue in the future, I recommend installing the version that tensorflow was compiled with:

sudo apt install libcudnn7-dev=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1 libcudnn7=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1

And then freezing this version in apt so it will not automatically upgrade them:

sudo apt-mark hold libcudnn7 libcudnn7-dev
body_text:
For people with similar issue issue in the future, I recommend installing the version that tensorflow was compiled with:
sudo apt install libcudnn7-dev=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1 libcudnn7=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1
And then freezing this version in apt so it will not automatically upgrade them:
sudo apt-mark hold libcudnn7 libcudnn7-dev
body:
For people with similar issue issue in the future, I recommend installing the version that `tensorflow` was compiled with:
```shell
sudo apt install libcudnn7-dev=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1 libcudnn7=7.0.5.15-1+cuda9.1
```
And then freezing this version in apt so it will not automatically upgrade them:
```shell
sudo apt-mark hold libcudnn7 libcudnn7-dev
```
